ONBOARDING.GREETING: Hi! I'm {botName}. And I loooove to play fetch!
ONBOARDING.NO_TEAMS: But it doesn't look like I have anything to fetch just yet {userName}. In order for me to fetch something, it first needs to be in a Team. Let's add one now!
ONBOARDING.TEAM_INTRO: A Team is how you organize your information for {botName} to access. Each Team is a unique repository that contains files, folders, and notes that {botName} can access for you on demand!
ONBOARDING.TEAM_PURPOSE: A Team can represent many different things. It could be used to organize class materials (notes, handouts, research) or represent a department (HR, Marketing, Sales) or even be a place for essential household information (finances, insurance, estate plans). The critical thing is each Team is information you find vital and you want {botName} to know.
ONBOARDING.TEAM_SECURITY: Finally, each Team you create is private, separate, and secure. That means that information in one Team is kept wholly separate from any other Team you add. Each Team is essentially a new {botName} AI you've trained to become an expert on just those materials!
ONBOARDING.TEAM_DESCRIPTION: Teams are how you organize all the information you want {botName} to be able to access. Each Team is unique and secure. Teams can represent anything you need to organize from class materials, organizational departments, key customers, or essential household information. If it's important to you and the people you live/work with, make it a Team!
ONBOARDING.GREETING_1: Hi {firstname}! I'm soooo happy to see you again! I'm ready to play fetch!
ONBOARDING.REFRESHER_NOTE: In case you need a refresher on how things work, here's some notes for you:
ONBOARDING.INTRO: I'm {botName}, your personal AI that helps you get answers <underline>really</underline> fast!
ONBOARDING.TEAMS_EXPLANATION: I dig through <link>Teams</link> to find these answers for you. <link>Teams</link> are all the important files and folders you want me to know and understand so I can be helpful to you and your friends.
ONBOARDING.CHOOSE_TEAM: To choose a <link>Teams</link> to work with, click the drop down menu beneath the {appName} logo at the top left. When you do, you'll see every available <link>Teams</link> you have to work with! Pick the one you want and we're off! Also, you can  click <link>Teams</link> in the menu to manage the <link>Teams</link> in the application.
ONBOARDING.FILES_INFO: Click Files in the menu and you can begin building your Teams. I can read Word files, Excel files, Text files, Powerpoints, HTML, PDFs and even those really poor quality, scanned twenty plus years ago PDFs that no one can read! Try me! You can also Add Notes which makes {appName} the perfect tool for classes and meetings!
ONBOARDING.ADD_REMOVE_INFO: You can add and remove Files, Notes and Folders from Teams at any time. When you remove something I immediately forget that information. When you add something it's immediately part of my memory!
ONBOARDING.CHAT_INFO: Click <chatLink>Chat</chatLink> when you want to play fetch with me! Simply enter your question into the prompt at the bottom of the screen (just like texting your best friend, which by the way, I am angling to become) and I'm off! You can rename a <chatLink>Chat</chatLink>, delete a <chatLink>Chat</chatLink>, add new <chatLink>Chats</chatLink>. It's all up to you!.
